Class PetRock

java.lang.Object
PetRock
public class PetRock extends Object
PetRock is a class that represents a pet rock.

The purpose of this class is to practice implementing the equals and hashCode methods. Each PetRock has a name, a happiness state, and a mass.

PetRock objects are immutable in terms of their name and mass, but their happiness state can change after the rock is petted.

  • Constructor Details

    • PetRock

      public PetRock(String name, double mass)
      Constructs a PetRock instance with the specified name and mass.

      The name and mass are final and cannot be changed once the PetRock is created. happiness is initialized to false, indicating the pet rock starts in an unhappy state.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the pet rock. Must be non-null and non-empty.
      mass - the mass of the pet rock. Must be a positive value.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null, empty, or if the mass is non-positive.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of this pet rock.
      Returns:
      the immutable name of the pet rock

    • getHappiness

      public boolean getHappiness()
      Returns the current happiness state of this pet rock.
      Returns:
      true if the rock has been petted, false otherwise

    • petTheRock

      public void petTheRock()
      Makes the pet rock happy by petting it.

      Once a rock has been petted, it remains happy forever.

    • getMass

      public double getMass()
      Returns the mass of the pet rock.
      Returns:
      the immutable mass of the pet rock in arbitrary units

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this PetRock to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null, is an instance of PetRock, and has the same name, happiness status, and mass (within three decimal places).
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare this PetRock against
      Returns:
      true if the given object represents a PetRock with the same name, happiness, and mass (within three decimal places); false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code value for PetRock.

      The hash code is computed based on the name, happiness, and mass (rounded to three decimal places).

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code value for PetRock.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of PetRock.

      The format is: PetRock{name='name', mass=mass, happiness=happiness}}

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this pet rock
